stories.title: USB magnetic tripwire wipes your LUKS Header if someone steals your laptop

stories.text:
I - like many people - have a number of devices that I don't use anymore. Things like iPhone 4s, iPad 4, some htc and Nokia devices, an old PC, etc.

I'm currently using my iPad 4 as a digital clock! I made a stand for it and I keep it charged all the time as the screen is always on.

But it bothers me that so much computation power is being wasted. I think old devices still can do something, esp. since most of their components still work.

I was thinking about running my website on the iPad 4, or running my personal VPN through some android devices. What other use cases have you come up with for your old devices?

As with the iPhone 4s, maybe I should just sell it to someone who collects these things at a good price!
stories.title: Ask HN: What to do with old devices that are not used anymore?
Hiring iOS Engineers â€“ Beginner Questions

stories.text:
I am considering creating a restriction preventing free credits from being doled out on my SaaS to users originating from a cloud-based IP address (AWS, Google, Azure, Etc.)

Curious what any pitfalls of this approach might be?

And any suggestions as to how to go about it?

Simply adding all cloud based company ips to a blacklist would be a good start. Do any half-decent ones already exist before I create my own?
stories.title: Ask HN: Trivial way to determine between ISP and cloud derived IPs?
Amazon Alexa Told a 10-Year-Old Girl to Play with a Live Wall Outlet
